adjectives.description: damned (comparative damneder or more damned, superlative damnedest or most damned)

entries.meaning: Variant of profane damn, used to express contempt, exasperation, etc. towards someone or something.
examples: Their damned lawyers can go to hell.
I can't get this damned thing to work.

entries.meaning: Used to express vehemently that one is not or does not do something, or refuses to be or do something.
examples: Damned if I know. (Strong assertion that you do not know)
I'll be damned if I let him get away with that. (Strong assertion that you will not let him get away with that)

adverbs.description: damned (comparative more damned, superlative most damned)

examples: What's so damned important about a football game?

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of damn
